button.4: Go to user devices impact assessment

explanation.1: One of the observations that prompted us to launch
explanation.1bis: was that we were sorely lacking in relevant data to measure the environmental impacts of digital technology. Beyond the impacts linked to the electricity consumption of the equipment used to deliver digital services, it is essential to know the impacts of the manufacturing, transport and end of life of all this equipment. Especially since for some of them, such as terminals and displays, these life cycle phases have a much greater impact than their electricity consumption
explanation.2: Until now, the impact measurements of these phases were complex to implement or required proprietary data, and involved times and costs far too important to be carried out regularly, even on simple perimeters.
explanation.3: Boavizta believes that an open and participatory approach would be much more appropriate to make digital environmental impact measurement accessible to as many people as possible.
explanation.4: As such, a database and open methodologies have been developed collectively by the working group and Datavizta aims to make the result of this work accessible in the form of easy to use tools.
explanation.5: We have opted to remove the access to the manufacturer impacts data due to concerns about its improper usage. Instead, we are offering a better alternative for assessing environmental impacts of end-user devices and servers. The raw data remains accessible on our GitHub repository; however, please note that it will no longer be subject to updates.
explanation.6: The impact assessment tool provides an understanding of the environmental impacts of servers, cloud instances and user terminals on several criteria (at least Global Warming Potential, Primary Energy and Abiotic Resource Depletion Potential), over two life cycle phases (use, manufacturing) based on their technical characteristics and context of use.

explanation.error: Data provided by manufacturer is not sufficient to allow you to personalize the lifespan and the use location.
explanation.1: With this page, Boavizta has sought to achieve several complementary objectives:
explanation.2: To be able to search easily for carbon impact factors for digital equipment in
explanation.4: To be able to visualize the impacts repartition by stages of the life cycle of equipment by differentiating the use phase (scope 2) from the manufacturing, transport and end-of-life phases (scope 3)
explanation.5: To be able to assess the impacts of extending the life of the product or using it in one geographical area rather than another.
explanation.6: The pie chart, below, displays the distribution of impacts by life cycle stage of devices referenced in the Boavizta environmental impact factor database built exclusively from manufacturer data. You can apply filters by manufacturer or device type by clicking on the buttons below the graph. Once the filter is applied, the graph is updated to show the impacts of all the selected devices.
explanation.7: We invite you, for example, to compare the impacts by category of equipment (Workplace and Datacenter) to realize: the importance of the manufacturing phase compared to the use phase for terminals and screens & the importance of the use phase for equipment present in datacenters. Using the form on the right of the graph, you can then vary the lifespan and choose a region of use for the selected equipment to see, on the graph, how this affects the overall impact and especially the distribution by phase of the life cycle. As an example, you can compare the impacts of using a server in France with those of using it in Poland.
explanation.8: You can vary the lifespan and choose a region of use for the selected equipment to see, on the graph, how this affects the overall impact and especially the distribution by phase of the life cycle.
explanation.9: As an example, you can compare the impacts of using a server in France with those of using it in Poland.
explanation.10: For more details about this tool, you can read
explanation.13: In particular, to understand the limits of use of this data exclusively provided by manufacturers.

impacts.GWP desc: Evaluates the effect on global warming
impacts.PE desc: Evaluates the consumption of energy resources
impacts.ADP desc: Evaluates the use of minerals and fossil resources
impacts.GWPPB desc: Evaluates the contribution of biogenic emissions
impacts.GWPPF desc: Evaluates the contribution of fossil fuel emissions
impacts.GWPPLU: Global Warming Potential - Land Use potential
impacts.GWPPLU desc: Evaluates the contribution of emissions from land use change
impacts.IR desc: Evaluates the emissions of radionizing substances
impacts.ODP desc: Evaluates Depletion of the Ozone Layer
impacts.MIPS desc: Evaluates material input per unit of service
impacts.ADPE: Abiotic Depletion Potential - mineral and metal
impacts.ADPE desc: Evaluates the use of mineral and metal resources
impacts.ADPF desc: Evaluates the use of fossil resources (including nuclear)
impacts.CTUH_NC desc: Evaluates human toxicity - Non carcinogenic effects

server-impact-desc.why_content: Through this page, Boavizta proposes you to understand the environmental impacts of servers on several criterias, on two life cycles phases (use, manufacture) according to their technical characteristics and context of use.
server-impact-desc.how_content1: The impacts related to manufacture are assessed using the methodology detailed by Boavizta in
server-impact-desc.how_content3: Those related to the use phase are evaluated from the average power consumption or modeled from the estimated server load. The methodology is detailed here:
server-impact-desc.further_content2: . An open-source API that uses open data and methods to assess the environmental impacts of digital equipment.
server-impact-desc.further_content4: . An open-source tool that combines real time inventory and usage data from your AWS account with Boavizta API to offer a view of your impacts.

terminal-impact-desc.how_content1: The impact related to manufacture are assessed using the Negaoctet's methodology and all impact factors are available on
terminal-impact-desc.how_content3: Those related to the use phase are evaluated from the average power consumption or modeled from the estimated device load. The methodology is detailed here:
terminal-impact-desc.further_content2: . An open-source API that uses open data and methods to assess the environmental impacts of digital equipment.
terminal-impact-desc.further_content4: . An open-source tool that combines real time inventory and usage data from your AWS account with Boavizta API to offer a view of your impacts.
